Greetings SOAR Families!

Tomorrow 6/13/19 is our Field Day Carnival for our students! Please read this whole post for some reminders and notifications:

Tomorrow will be our hottest and sunniest Field Day ever!

We welcome students to bring personal bottles of water. Please put your student's name on the water bottle.

We highly encourage the use of sunscreen! Sunscreen is considered an over the counter medication so SOAR is NOT allowed to provide or apply sunscreen for your students.

We will have a break time inside with otter pops to cool off midday after lunch and there are shaded areas for students to have a break.

There will also be a liability waiver required for students to play on the bounce house and inflatable slide we have rented. We began passing out this morning and will post on facebook, email, classdojo, and hand out during pick up.

This event is only for students and pre-approved volunteers. If you are unsure if you are volunteering, please contact the office.

Feel free to call the front office for any questions you may have!

This week in STEAM we are looking at an example of the engineering design process.

For homework we are asking our students to use their “Small Parts Test Fixture” to collect data on what is considered to be a choking hazard. It can be a list on any sheet of paper and spelling doesn't count. Illustrations of items are great too! If you need another copy of the tool, email Ms. Salo at nsalo@soaracademies.org.

This is a tool used to check for choking hazards. If an item fits in the device it could be considered a choking hazard, as defined by the CPSC, Consumer Product Safety Commission.

This tool doesn’t stop choking accidents, but it can certainly prevent them when used with fidelity.

This tool can be used to determine unsafe items in reach of a toddler or baby.

The best prevention of choking is supervision.

post_text:
Dear SOAR community,

This morning, we learned of the loss of cherished members of our SOAR family in a car accident. Lisa and Tytis Boquet, their mother Erika and their sister Bella shared their love and brightness with our community for over three years. They will be profoundly missed. As we process our own shock and sorrow, we recognize the impact of this event for all who knew the family.

SOAR staff and trained grief counselors are here on site and available to provide support, answer questions about how to discuss the event, process grief with students, and honor our memories of the family together. We encourage you to take advantage of our resources. We will be here from 8:00-5:00 daily. After hours, please feel free to reach out via facebook and someone will respond ASAP.

Our hearts are heavy with this news. As we know more, we will provide updates, and of course, all are welcome to reach out to me directly at any time.

With love and in solidarity,
Lihi Rosenthal
Executive Director

SOAR Parents Advisory Council
December 8, 2017 at 12:12 PM ·

Seattle Opera is on campus at SOAR Academy!

Over the next two school days, *all* of our K-2 students will be moving, reading, and singing along during a special Read Together, Sing Together class, part of a musical storytelling program from Seattle Opera that fosters literacy in and through the arts.

Enjoy this glimpse of one of our kindergarten groups SOAR-ing in song first thing this morning with incredible visiting teaching artist John Coons! We're so grateful for the privilege to have him work with our kiddos!

(This curriculum is tailored to the lower elementary grades, there may be a similar opportunity for our older students in the spring, we'll keep you posted! Shout-out to Jessica Stryczek for the video.)
